title: Bug 22360 [Fonts] FontRegistry instantiation issue with resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource
description: Bug 22360 [Fonts] FontRegistry cannot be instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource. Currently, all resources being looked up are relative to the location of the FontRegistry class in the org.eclipse.jface.resource path. This issue can be addressed by allowing FontRegistry to take a client class (or class loader) as an additional parameter in the constructor.
EB: Creating a FontRegistry instance should not result in a MissingResourceException when using the provided code.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Use the code:

```java
com.company.product.MyClass
public void createFontRegistry(){
  FontRegistry fonts = new FontRegistry("com.company.product.fonts");
}
```

2. Ensure there is a file named fonts.properties in the com/company/product/ folder.
3. Observe the MissingResourceException.

Alternatively:
1. Use the code:

```java
com.company.product.MyClass
public void createFontRegistry(){
  ResourceBundle fonts = ResourceBundle.getBundle("com.company.product.fonts");
}
```

2. Ensure there is a file named fonts.properties in the com/company/product/ folder.
3. Verify that no exception occurs.

Furthermore, replicating the FontRegistry class in the com.company.product package eliminates the issue, suggesting a potential bug in the FontRegistry.
